books.author: by Barack Obama
books.description: In the first volume of his presidential memoirs, Barack Obama offers personal reflections on his formative years and pivotal moments through his first term.
books.name: A PROMISED LAND

books.author: by Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.
books.name: CASTE

books.author: by Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years.
books.name: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: by Timothy Snyder
books.description: Twenty lessons from the 20th century about the course of tyranny.
books.name: ON TYRANNY

books.author: by Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.
books.name: UNTAMED

books.author: by George Saunders
books.description: A collection of essays examining the functions and importance of works of fiction.
books.name: A SWIM IN A POND IN THE RAIN

books.author: by Kurt Andersen
books.description: The author of “Fantasyland” looks at the economic, cultural and political forces to which he ascribes the undermining and dismantling of the American middle class.
books.name: EVIL GENIUSES

books.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.
books.name: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: by Amber Ruffin and Lacey Lamar
books.description: A pair of sisters who live in different parts of the country share their perspectives on the absurdities and everyday experiences of racism.
books.name: YOU'LL NEVER BELIEVE WHAT HAPPENED TO LACEY

books.author: by Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.
books.name: BECOMING

books.author: by Ibram X. Kendi
books.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.
books.name: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST

books.author: by Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.
books.name: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS

books.author: by Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.name: EDUCATED

books.author: by James Comey
books.description: The former F.B.I. director incorporates his experiences into lessons on how the federal justice system functions.
books.name: SAVING JUSTICE

books.author: by Erik Larson
books.description: An examination of the leadership of the prime minister Winston Churchill.
books.name: THE SPLENDID AND THE VILE
